intro: Elatostema crassimucronatum, commonly known as the broad-tipped elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema crassimucronatum is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
